results.title: Symbol formation & acquisition of language
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, GPN and DLGHS
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
A child’s capacity to learn symbols is the first step to acquiring language. Through observations of a deaf family who converse in American sign language, and visits to a family with a child learning to speak, we are shown how language facilitates self-awareness and builds a child’s understanding of the world.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, GPN and DLGHS

results.title: Individual differences & developmental milestones
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, GPN and DLGHS
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Traces the course of sensorimotor development over the first year. Examines the results of comtemporary research on temperament, auditory and visual acuity, depth perception, phonemic discrimination and cross-modality matching. Presents newborns as they confront situations that allow them to exhibit their capacity to act, learn and remember.

results.title: Family life & the active child
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, GPN and DLGHS
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
We learn how families bring the wider world home to children, and how they sometimes serve as a place where society’s failings can begin to be reversed. Christmas Day with families in New York and Moscow serve as the background for an overview of issues relating to family structure and dynamics.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, GPN and DLGHS

results.title: Culture, time & place
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, GPN and DLGHS
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Language, schooling and the interactions of everyday life are vehicles of acculturation that communicate values, beliefs, attitudes and expectations to children. Observing a traditional Japanese religious festival, we explore the myth and ritual which help children see their relationship to time, place and values.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, GPN and DLGHS

results.title: Nature & nurture interwoven
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, GPN and DLGHS
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Research in behaviour genetics, the concept of inheritability and data from twin studies are juxtaposed with observations about how parents change the future by changing the circumstances of children’s lives. Observes urban Brazilian children meeting their country cousins in the context of the nature versus nurture debate.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, GPN and DLGHS

results.title: Prenatal development & the birth process
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt and George A. Colburn
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Examines research on the prenatal period, as well as neonatal starting dates that facilitate an infant’s survival. Alternative birth processes are analysed. Families in Brazil, Russia and the U.S. prepare for birth and go through delivery. Human genetics principles, prenatal care and risk factors are considered.
results.description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Examines research on the prenatal period, as well as neonatal starting dates that facilitate an infant’s survival. Alternative birth processes are analysed. Families in Brazil, Russia and the U.S. prepare for birth and go through delivery. Human genetics principles, prenatal care and risk factors are considered.

results.title: The Ecology of development
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, GPN and DLGHS
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Factors such as biological inheritance, temperament, caregiving, family, peers, schooling, culture and history are introduced. Four levels of the environment are defined and illustrated: microsystem, mesosystem, exosystem and macrosystem. We meet twelve families from five countries whose lives we share throughout the series.

results.title: Development & diversity
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, GPN and DLGHS
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Exploration of the historical, cultural, and individual diversity of childhood: what development is, how it occurs and the significance of the the prolonged period of human infancy and childhood. A visual tour of development includes children in Russia, Japan, Brazil, Cameroon and New York.

results.title: History in action
results.creator_credit: Julia Spark and Granada Television International
results.brief_description: History, when viewed with hindsight, has the aura of inevitability. This series reviews key events of the 20th Century and examines the reaction to these events as they actually occurred. Each programme uses original material such as newspapers, photographs, archival footage, cartoons and music to enhance the contemporary feel.

results.title: Crisis over Cuba
results.creator_credit: Brian Blake and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode number 16 of Series “History in action”.
On 29th August 1962, American Intelligence sources indicated that missile sites had been established in Cuba. The weapons observed were identified as surface to air missiles of a defensive nature and were thus dismissed by US authorities as insignificant. Six weeks later, US spy planes took photographs of what appeared to be launch pads for long-range missiles and it was confirmed that the Soviet Union had placed offensive missiles in Cuba, capable of attacking the United States. The Cuban Missile Crisis had begun.
